Description: Two segments of a limestone arch. The flat face of each arch segment is carved in sunk relief with roundels alternately containing rosettes and grape bunches. At the base of each segment, carved in raised relief, are a nude male figure straddling a dolphin (left) and another figure, largely destroyed (right). The obliquely angled outer edge of each arch segment is carved with a border of heart-shaped leaves; their undersides are carved with a foliate pattern.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Monastery of Apa Jeremias (said to be from)
Curator's comments: Cf. EA 1538 Missing fragment now identified as EA 74868 and reattached.
Bibliographic references: Eaton-Krauss 2010 / Some Coptic reliefs purportedly from Coptos (203)
